TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ArduinoBoard extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ArduinoBoard extends Iot.Device.Board.Board implements class System.IDisposable
Public Class ArduinoBoard Inherits Board Implements IDisposable
type ArduinoBoard = class inherit Board interface IDisposable

Docs.summary: Implements an interface to an arduino board which is running Firmata. See documentation on how to prepare your arduino board to work with this. Note that the program will run on the PC, so you cannot disconnect the Arduino while this driver is connected.

MemberSignature.Value: public ArduinoBoard (System.IO.Stream serialPortStream);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IO.Stream serialPortStream) cil managed
Public Sub New (serialPortStream As Stream)
new Iot.Device.Arduino.ArduinoBoard : System.IO.Stream -> Iot.Device.Arduino.ArduinoBoard

Docs.param: A stream to an Arduino/Firmata device
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of an Ardino board connection using the given stream (typically from a serial port)
Docs.remarks: The device is initialized when the first command is sent. The constructor always succeeds.

MemberSignature.Value: public ArduinoBoard (string portName, int baudRate);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string portName, int32 baudRate) cil managed
Public Sub New (portName As String, baudRate As Integer)
new Iot.Device.Arduino.ArduinoBoard : string * int -> Iot.Device.Arduino.ArduinoBoard

Docs.param: Port name. On Windows, this is usually "COM3" or "COM4" for an Arduino attached via USB. On Linux, possible values include "/dev/ttyAMA0", "/dev/serial0", "/dev/ttyUSB1", etc.
Baudrate to use. It is recommended to use at least 115200 Baud.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the Arduino board connection connected to a serial port

Docs.summary: Connect to a device connected to the primary SPI bus on the Arduino Firmata's default implementation has no SPI support, so this first checks whether it's available at all.
Docs.exception: The Bus number is not 0, or the SPI component has not been enabled in the firmware.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetPinMode (int pin, Iot.Device.Arduino.SupportedMode arduinoMode);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetPinMode(int32 pin, class Iot.Device.Arduino.SupportedMode arduinoMode) cil managed
Public Sub SetPinMode (pin As Integer, arduinoMode As SupportedMode)
member this.SetPinMode : int * Iot.Device.Arduino.SupportedMode -> unit

Docs.summary: Sets the internal pin mode to the given value, if supported.
Docs.remarks: This method is intended for use by instances. Users should not call this method directly. It is the responsibility of the command handler to use the capabilities table to check that the mode is actually supported
Docs.exception: The mode was not updated, either because the command was not understood or the mode is unknown by the firmware

.method public static hidebysig bool TryConnectToNetworkedBoard(class System.Net.IPAddress boardAddress, int32 port, [out] class Iot.Device.Arduino.ArduinoBoard& board) cil managed
Public Shared Function TryConnectToNetworkedBoard (boardAddress As IPAddress, port As Integer, ByRef board As ArduinoBoard) As Boolean
static member TryConnectToNetworkedBoard : System.Net.IPAddress * int * ArduinoBoard -> bool

Docs.param: The IP address of the board
Docs.summary: Tries to connect to an arduino over network. This requires an arduino with an ethernet shield or an ESP32 with enabled WIFI support.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool TryFindBoard (out Iot.Device.Arduino.ArduinoBoard? board);
.method public static hidebysig bool TryFindBoard([out] class Iot.Device.Arduino.ArduinoBoard& board) cil managed
Public Shared Function TryFindBoard (ByRef board As ArduinoBoard) As Boolean
static member TryFindBoard : ArduinoBoard -> bool

Docs.param: A board, already open and initialized. Null if none was found.
Docs.summary: Searches all available com ports for an Arduino device.
Docs.returns: True if a board was found, false otherwise
Docs.remarks: Scanning serial ports may affect unrelated devices. If there are problems, use the overload excluding ports that shall not be tested.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool TryFindBoard (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> comPorts, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<int> baudRates, out Iot.Device.Arduino.ArduinoBoard? board);

.method public static hidebysig bool TryFindBoard(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> comPorts, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<int32> baudRates, [out] class Iot.Device.Arduino.ArduinoBoard& board) cil managed
Public Shared Function TryFindBoard (comPorts As IEnumerable(Of String), baudRates As IEnumerable(Of Integer), ByRef board As ArduinoBoard) As Boolean
static member TryFindBoard : seq<string> * seq<int> * ArduinoBoard -> bool

Docs.param: List of com ports. Can be used with .
List of baud rates to test. .
[Out] Returns the board reference. It is already initialized.
Docs.summary: Searches the given list of com ports for a firmata device.
Docs.returns: True on success, false if no board was found
Docs.remarks: Scanning ports and testing for devices may affect unrelated devices. It is advisable to exclude ports known to contain other hardware from this scan. A board won't be found if its port is already open (by the same or a different process).
